intro: Goniothalamus kunstleri var. macranthus, commonly known as the large-flowered goniothalamus, is a member of the Annonaceae family. It is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its elongated, compound leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers with a strong fragrance. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds, and the plant is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
